settings.text: Ailsa’s Wigs operates as an independent brand within the 121shoes retail premises at Cameron Toll Shopping Centre in Edinburgh. This is a shared retail space, but Ailsa’s manages all branding, customer service, consultations, and transactions independently. Customers can visit by appointment for consultations, free try-ons, and in-store order collection.

settings.form_description: We would love to answer any questions you may have. Please use the form below, and one of our team members will get back to you as soon as possible.

This store offers appointment-based services including personalised wig consultations, free in-store try-ons, and order pickup.
To book an appointment, please use the form above or email us at hello@ailsas.com.

settings.heading: Our Privacy Policy
settings.row_content: Alisas.com respects and protects the privacy of our users. For your privacy protection, all packages are shipped in unmarked packaging. In order to provide the best service to our customers, Ailsas.com regularly sends out special offers and discounts via electronic notification (email). You can unsubscribe from our notifications at any time by clicking the unsubscribe link at the bottom of Ailsas.com emails or by sending an unsubscribe email to hello@ailsas.com.

settings.heading: BEAUTY AND HAIR PRIVACY POLICY
settings.row_content: This Privacy Policy describes how your personal information is collected, used and shared when you visit Ailsas.com (the "Site") or make a purchase.

settings.heading: PERSONAL INFORMATION WE COLLECT
settings.row_content: When you visit this website, we automatically collect certain information about your device, including information about your web browser, IP address, time zone, and some cookies installed on your device. In addition, as you browse this website, we collect information about the individual pages or products you view, which websites or search terms brought you to this website, and information about how you interact with this website. We refer to this automatically collected information as "Device Information".

settings.heading: We collect Device Information using the following technologies
settings.row_content:
“Cookies” are data files that are placed on your device or computer and often include an anonymous unique identifier. For more information about cookies, and how to disable cookies, visit http://www.allaboutcookies.org.

“Log files” track actions occurring on the Site, and collect data including your IP address, browser type, Internet service provider, referring/exit pages, and date/time stamps.

“Web beacons,” “tags,” and “pixels” are electronic files used to record information about how you browse the Site.

"Javascript" is a web technology that gathers data such as browser, device, mouse coordinates, screen resolution, mouse clicks, page navigation, URLs that help us to monitor and improve the website.

In addition, we collect certain information from you when you make a purchase or attempt to purchase through this site, including your name, billing address, shipping address, payment information (including credit card number, email address and phone number. We refer to this information as "Order Information").

When we talk about “Personal Information” in this Privacy Policy, we are talking both about Device Information and Order Information.

settings.heading: HOW DO WE USE YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION?
settings.row_content:
We use the order information we generally collect to complete any orders placed through the Site (including processing your payment information, arranging shipping and providing you with invoices and/or order confirmations). Additionally, we use this order information to:

- Communicate with you - Monitor and improve our website

- Screen our orders for potential risk or fraud

- Provide you with information or advertisements related to our products or services when in line with the preferences you share with us.

- We use the device information we collect to help us screen for potential risk and fraud (especially your IP address), and more generally to improve and optimize our website (for example, by generating information about how our customers are analysis of browsing and interaction with the website, and evaluating the success of our marketing and advertising campaigns).

settings.heading: SHARING YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION
settings.row_content: We share your Personal Information with third parties to help us use your Personal Information, as described above.  For example, we use Shopify to power our online store--you can read more about how Shopify uses your Personal Information here:  https://www.shopify.com/legal/privacy.  We also use Google Analytics to help us understand how our customers use the Site--you can read more about how Google uses your Personal Information here:  https://www.google.com/intl/en/policies/privacy/.  You can also opt-out of Google Analytics here:  https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout.   Finally, we may also share your Personal Information to comply with applicable laws and regulations, to respond to a subpoena, search warrant or other lawful request for information we receive, or to otherwise protect our rights.

settings.heading: BEHAVIOURAL ADVERTISING
settings.row_content:
As described above, we use your personal information to provide you with targeted advertising or marketing communications that we believe may be of interest to you. For more information on how targeted advertising works, you can visit the Network Advertising Initiative's ("NAI") education page at http://www.networkadvertising.org/understanding-online-advertising/how-does-it-work . 

You can opt out of targeted advertising by:
FACEBOOK - https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=ads
GOOGLE - https://www.google.com/settings/ads/anonymous
BING - https://advertise.bingads.microsoft.com/en-us/resources/policies/personalized-ads
Additionally, you can opt out of some of these services by visiting the Digital Advertising Alliance’s opt-out portal at:  http://optout.aboutads.info/.

settings.heading: DO NOT TRACK
settings.row_content: Please note that when we see a "Do Not Track" signal from your browser, we do not change our website's data collection and use practices.

settings.heading: YOUR RIGHTS
settings.row_content: If you are a European resident, you have the right to access the personal information we hold about you and to request that your personal information be corrected, updated or deleted. If you would like to exercise this right, please contact us at hello@ailsas.com to request your information. In addition, if you are a resident of Europe, we notice that we are processing your information to fulfill the contract we may sign with you (for example, if you place an order through this website), or otherwise pursue the legitimate business interests listed above. In addition, please note that your information will be transmitted outside Europe, including Canada and the United States.

settings.heading: DATA RETENTION
settings.row_content: When you place an order through this website, we will retain your order information for our records unless you request that we delete this information.

settings.heading: CHANGES
settings.row_content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect, for example, changes in our practices or other operational, legal or regulatory reasons.

settings.heading: CONTACT US
settings.row_content:
For more information about our privacy practices, if you have questions, or if you would like to make a complaint, please contact us by e-mail at hello@ailsas.com or by mail using the details provided below: Ailsas.com, Unit 8, Cameron Toll Shopping Centre, 6 Lady Rd, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

hello@ailsas.com
